about.title: Why me
about.intro: I’m a passionate Frontend Developer who thrives at the intersection of design and technology. For me, coding is more than just writing lines of code – it’s about crafting intuitive, engaging, and visually appealing digital experiences that bring ideas to life.

skills.title: My Skills
skills.challengeText:
I am always happy to learn new technologies,
just tell me what you need.

join.description: Join is a collaborative Kanban board for task management. Organize tasks via drag-and-drop, filter and search; comments and statuses support team workflows. Firebase provides authentication and real-time sync so changes are visible instantly. The responsive UI is designed for fast, clear interaction.

el-pollo-loco.description: El Pollo Loco is a 2D side-scrolling browser platformer. Collect coins and salsa bottles, avoid enemies, stomp chickens, and defeat the final boss with bottle throws. Built in vanilla JavaScript with an OOP structure; animation loop, collision checks and sprite handling power smooth gameplay. Status bars show health, coins and bottles.

pokedex.description: Pokédex is a web app that fetches Pokémon data from the PokeAPI. Search and filter Pokémon; cards show image, types and ID. A modal with tabs (Main, Stats, Evo Chain) provides details like height, weight, abilities and base stats. The UI is responsive and uses Bootstrap; “Load more” fetches additional entries.

portfolio.description: My personal portfolio focused on performance, accessibility and a clean UI. Built with Angular, custom animation directives (Reveal, Split Letters, Parallax) and i18n (DE/EN). The responsive SCSS layout scales from mobile to desktop. Content and projects are structured and easy to extend.

tasks.description: Tasks is a React-based to-do app with a Firebase backend. Users log in via Firebase Authentication and manage tasks in real-time with Firestore. Tasks can be created, edited, deleted, and filtered by status; sorting options like “Newest first” / “Oldest first” as well as a search function provide clarity. The clean card-based UI is responsive and easy to use.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This notice explains how I process personal data when you use this website and how you can exercise your rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

paragraphs.accessLogs: When you access this site, the web server processes technical data (e.g., IP address, date/time, URL, referrer, user agent) to deliver the website and ensure security. Processing is based on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interests in operating a secure and reliable website). Log files are retained only as long as necessary and then deleted or anonymised.
paragraphs.contact: If you contact me (e.g., via contact form or email), I process your data (name, email, message and any information you provide) to handle your request. The legal basis is Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR (pre-contractual/contractual communication) or Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interests in responding to inquiries). Data will be deleted when your inquiry has been resolved unless legal retention duties require otherwise.
paragraphs.cookies: This site is designed to work without non-essential cookies. If I ever use non-essential cookies (e.g., analytics), I will request your consent first. In Germany, storing or accessing information on your device requires consent under § 25 TTDSG unless strictly necessary.
paragraphs.thirdparty: If I embed third-party content (e.g., GitHub, LinkedIn, external images, fonts or videos), the providers may receive your IP address and set their own technologies. Please refer to the respective providers’ privacy policies. Where possible, I use privacy-friendly defaults (no tracking, deferred loading).
paragraphs.processors: I may use service providers (e.g., hosting, email) who process data on my behalf under Art. 28 GDPR. If providers outside the EU/EEA are used, transfers comply with Chapter V GDPR (e.g., adequacy decision or appropriate safeguards).
paragraphs.storage: I retain personal data only as long as necessary for the purposes described or to comply with legal obligations; afterwards data is deleted or anonymised.
paragraphs.rights: You have the right of access (Art. 15 GDPR), rectification (Art. 16 GDPR), erasure (Art. 17 GDPR), restriction (Art. 18 GDPR), data portability (Art. 20 GDPR), and to object (Art. 21 GDPR). Where processing is based on consent, you can withdraw it at any time with effect for the future (Art. 7(3) GDPR). You also have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority (Art. 77 GDPR).
